terms.definition: A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or files over time, allowing users to see revision history and ensure everyone uses the most current version.
The systematic organization, storage, and retrieval of documents in a centralized system to improve accessibility and workflow efficiency.
The ability to track and document the history, application, or location of an item through recorded identification numbers and audit trails.
The process of organizing and compiling necessary documentation and records to demonstrate compliance during regulatory or quality reviews.
A systematic approach to monitor and document adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and internal policies.
A single, unified system where all documents, data, and resources are stored and accessed from one location rather than multiple disparate systems.
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously work on, edit, and comment on documents with changes visible instantly to all participants.
A security feature that controls which users can view, edit, or access specific documents and system functions based on their authorization level.
A complete record of all changes, revisions, and modifications made to a document over time, including who made changes and when.
Older software applications or computing systems that are still in use but may be outdated or incompatible with newer technologies.
The seamless connection of documentation processes with existing business systems and procedures to maintain operational continuity.
Federal Aviation Administration - the U.S. government agency responsible for regulating and overseeing civil aviation safety standards.
European Union Aviation Safety Agency - the European regulatory body responsible for civil aviation safety in EU member states.
International Traffic in Arms Regulations - U.S. regulations that control the export and import of defense-related articles and services.
Work groups composed of members from different departments or disciplines who collaborate to achieve common project goals and objectives.
